titlestmt.titleproper: Neil Basen Socialist Women Research Collection TAM.476
titlestmt.author: Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:53:34 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Neil Basen Socialist Women Research Collection
did.abstract: Neil Basen, formerly Assistant Professor of History at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, conducted research on leading U.S. socialist women of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. This collection contains a small portion of Neil Basen' correspondence with other scholars, descendants of several of these women, and clippings by and about these women, who are: Mary Beals, Viola Coche Dietz, Ida Crouch Hazlett, Luella Krehbiel, and Anna Maley.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 2009.032.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Neil Basen, formerly Assistant Professor of History at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, conducted extensive research on leading U.S. socialist women of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a small portion of Neil Basen' correspondence with other scholars, descendants of several of these women, and clippings by and about these women, who are: Mary Beals, Viola Coche Dietz, Ida Crouch Hazlett, Luella Krehbiel, and Anna Maley.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1902-1978, are expected to enter the public domain in 2098.
